please.translation[0].definitions[0].def: used to be polite when asking someone to do something
please.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Could you please clean up the living room?
please.translation[0].definitions[1].def: used to be polite when asking for something
please.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I’d like a cup of coffee, please.
Please can I go to Rebecca’s house?
please.translation[0].definitions[2].def: said in order to politely accept something that someone offers you
please.translation[1].definitions[0].def: said when you think what someone has just said or asked is not possible or reasonable
please.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Oh, please, he’d never do that.
please.translation[1].definitions[1].def: used to ask someone to stop behaving badly
please.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to make someone happy or satisfied
please.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: a business that wants to please its customers
She did everything she could to please him.
Most children are eager to please.
She’s hard to please. Everything has to be perfect.
please.translation[2].definitions[0].not: Please is not used in the progressive You say

I do it because it is pleasing me
please.translation[2].definitions[1].def: used in some phrases to show that someone can do or have what they want
